intro: Pleurothallis pansamalae, commonly known as the Panamá orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of Panama. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and deriving moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and role in the biodiversity of its native habitat.
